meanings.sent1: The playground was dickty after the rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: Her room was always dickty with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent3: He tried to clean up the dickty kitchen but ended up making it messier.

meanings.sent5: The dickty streets were filled with litter and debris, making it hard to walk.

meanings.definition: (noun) a person who is unkempt or slovenly
meanings.sent1: The new student was labeled as a dickty by his classmates.
meanings.sent2: She always avoided sitting next to the dickty in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent3: The dickty at the party stood out with his disheveled appearance.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the villain was portrayed as a dickty with a sinister grin.
meanings.sent5: The office had a reputation for hiring dickties who never followed the dress code.

meanings.definition: (verb) to make something dirty or messy
meanings.sent1: The kids managed to dickty up the living room in just a few minutes.
meanings.sent2: Please don't dickty the freshly cleaned car with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent3: He always had a knack for dicktying up his workspace right after it was organized.

meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally dicktied the kitchen while preparing multiple dishes at once.
